I'm telling you,  you guys are a wealth of information to a "newbie" like
me. O.K. then, Bar-B-Q? Check. Motor oil? Check. Bucket of acid? Check. Sand
blaster? Check. And lots not forget the soft cloth,  check.  LOL

On a slightly serious note,  are any of you aware of a book that will tell
how to actually pronounce nihonto related words?  Or anywhere's on the web?

Thanks,  Mark

  -----Original Message-----
  From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Richard Turner
  Sent: Friday, September 09, 2005 8:53 AM
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Tsuba care question


  how about an acid dip, followed by vigorous rubbing metal polish, then
  heated with an oxy torch, followed by sand blasting, then chroming, then
  a light buff with a soft cloth.

  Just like new :-)

  Rich

  > --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@w...>

  > > egads, don;t say that, I know an Ozzie antique dealer that does just

  > >
  > > Rich
  >
  > Hey, why not, I'm sure we can come up with lots
